definition: cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement

sentences.english: He cheerfully went off to school.
sentences.chinese: 他高高兴兴地上学去了。

sentences.english: "Then give it all up", said the Master cheerfully.
sentences.chinese: “那就都别做吧，”大师高高兴兴地说。

sentences.english: He jollied her along until she agreed to go with him.
sentences.chinese: 他把她哄得高高兴兴地同意跟他一道去了。

sentences.english: Happily, they all went back to the house.
sentences.chinese: 他们都高高兴兴地回屋了。

sentences.english: Shi Hou believed his father really wanted to help him, so the Emperor and he happily went to State of Chen.
sentences.chinese: 石厚以为父亲真的帮他，他们高高兴兴地去了陈国。

sentences.english: ” So the boy cut all the branches off the tree and left happily.
sentences.chinese: 男孩十分激动，他摘下所有的苹果，高高兴兴地走了。

sentences.english: Xiao-Ming Zizi sweet heart, and happily go home.
sentences.chinese: 小明心里甜滋滋的，高高兴兴地回家了。

sentences.english: Go now! That man happily made several more kowtows and left.
sentences.chinese: 那人高高兴兴地又磕了几个头，这才去了。

sentences.english: Linda and John are strolling happily arm in arm.
sentences.chinese: 琳达和约翰臂挽臂高高兴兴地散步。

sentences.english: I hope to welcome the new semester with them happily together.
sentences.chinese: 我希望跟他们一起高高兴兴迎接新学期的到来。

sentences.english: Ellen said as she happily set a bowl of mashed potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦说，高高兴兴地端上来一盆土豆泥。

sentences.english: Happily, he began to play the course.
sentences.chinese: 他高高兴兴地挥起杆来。

sentences.english: During the Lantern Festival, children go out at night carrying lanterns with much pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚上，孩子们提着花灯高高兴兴地在街上游玩。

sentences.english: So, happily for the whole family moved in.
sentences.chinese: 于是，全家人便高高兴兴的搬了进去。

sentences.english: Elizabeth took leave of the whole party in the liveliest spirits.
sentences.chinese: 伊丽莎白高高兴兴地告别了大家。

sentences.english: Our family happily eating in the courtyard, family reunion dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我们一家人在院子里高高兴兴的吃团圆饭。

definition: happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
talking and laughing/to jest/cheerful and lively
at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
